  • Field Details

    • tokens

      public String[] tokens

  • Constructor Details

    • GameLogic

      public GameLogic()
      Constructor for GameLogic class. This class calls the initiatize method and it initialises the tokens array with all the possible values of the back of the tokens. This has been hard coded into an array for now as this will mainly be needed for future implementation.

  • Method Details

    • initialize

      public void initialize()
      Initiatise method which creates the first frame asking the players how many players they would like to play with. This then links to another frame which is the GameBoard for the game. The formatting for both pages is also done in this method. Some buttons used for functionality like the "Click Here" button and selecting a random token from the tokens array are also implemented here.

    • getTokensLength

      public int getTokensLength()
      Getter for the length of the tokens array.
      Returns:
      integer representing the number of items in the tokens array

    • run

      public void run​(String selectedToken)
      Run method which contains the main functionality of the game. Checks what card the dragon is standing on and compares this to the token which has been flipped over. If they match, the dragon moves how many spots the selected token states. A text will appear at the bottom to explain what has happened in the game. This will then be repeated for each dragon (not implemented yet). If the animal the dragon is standing on and the flipped token do not match, it will be the next players turn (not implemented yet). This method is called inside this function infinitely for now as the winning scenario has not yet been implemented.
      Parameters:
      selectedToken - the token which has been flipped over form the centre of the GameBoard (currently selected randomly)
